title: How luxury campsites are transforming South America's land of mountains and magic
text:
Posh camping in Bolivia gave James Stewart the chance to experience its true magic, without eschewing hotel comforts

Do you know how the llama got its name? Bolivians say that when the Spanish pushed into the heartland of the Inca Empire (today’s western Bolivia) in the 1530s they were impressed by the strange beasts of burden – strong, resilient and covered by a fleece that produced a uniquely warm wool. What do you call them, the Conquistadors asked: “Como se llama?” “Llama,” repeated the Incas, confused.

I mention this story because there are two Bolivias. One is a familiar country of Catholicism, smartphones and Toyota Land Cruisers. The other is a country the Incas might recognise, one infested...
